Be Counted in the 2020 Census!
The census happens once every decade with the mission of counting every person living in the United States.
Starting this month, the U.S. Census Bureau will send each household a postcard inviting residents to respond to the census online, by phone or by mail. Only one person should complete the census for the entire household.
Obtaining an accurate count of Michigan residents is critically important as it determines the amount of federal funding our state will receive for essential services that impact communities, including Michigan schools, and government agencies. The census count is also used to shape the state's congressional representation.
To learn more about the Michigan 2020 Census, visit michigan.gov/census2020.

Thank you.
